poem:
Title: "Beneath a Bleeding Sky"

Between Jabalia and Rafah
The dance of war intensifies –
tanks push, houses crumble,
voices stilled. Tenacious
medics count the fallen leaves
of humanity – five, six, seven…

In halls of justice, a gavel waits,
its echo drowned in the
angry hum of conflict.
In the orchard of strife,
Who will tend the battered trees,
Bruised fruits of broken peace?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Bodies of three more hostages recovered by Israeli military; ICJ set to make new ruling on war in Gaza 1.05pm BST Israeli forces intensify attacks in Jabalia and Rafah Israeli forces intensified their strikes on Gaza with heavy fighting reported in Jabalia in the north and tanks pushing further into Rafah in the south. Medics said at least five Palestinians were killed when houses were hit in Jabalia and more were believed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: Bodies of three more hostages recovered by Israeli military; ICJ set to make new ruling on war in Gaza 1.05pm BST Israeli forces intensify attacks in Jabalia and Rafah Israeli forces intensified their strikes on Gaza with heavy fighting reported in Jabalia in the north and tanks pushing further into Rafah in the south.
